content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?><xml>   <node>     <title><a href="/issue72/ozono-et-al">Shared Repositories, Shared Benefits: Regional and Consortial Repositories in Japan</a></title>     <articleSummary>Takeo Ozono, Daisuke Ueda and Fumiyo Ozaki describe the work of the ShaRe Project and its influence upon the development of consortial repositories and the benefits they have brought to Japanese institutions.</articleSummary>     <issueNumber><a href="/issue72">issue72</a></issueNumber>     <publishedDate>March 2014</publishedDate>     <articleType><a href="/category/article-type/feature-article">feature article</a></articleType>     <authors><a href="/taxonomy/term/16262/author-info">daisuke ueda</a>, <a href="/taxonomy/term/16263/author-info">fumiyo ozaki</a>, <a href="/taxonomy/term/16261/author-info">takeo ozono</a></authors>   </node>   <node>     <title><a href="/issue71/tsuchide-et-al">Hita-Hita: Open Access and Institutional Repositories in Japan Ten Years On</a></title>     <articleSummary>Ikuko Tsuchide, Yui Nishizono, Masako Suzuki, Shigeki Sugita, Kazuo Yamamoto and Hideki Uchijima introduce a number of ideas and projects that have enhanced the progress of the Open Access movement and institutional repositories in Japan over the last ten years.</articleSummary>     <issueNumber><a href="/issue71">issue71</a></issueNumber>     <publishedDate>July 2013</publishedDate>     <articleType><a href="/taxonomy/term/16224/author-info">ikuko tsuchide</a>, <a href="/taxonomy/term/16228/author-info">kazuo yamamoto</a>, <a href="/taxonomy/term/16226/author-info">masako suzuki</a>, <a href="/taxonomy/term/16227/author-info">shigeki sugita</a>, <a href="/taxonomy/term/16225/author-info">yui nishizono</a></authors>   </node>   <node>     <title><a href="/issue49/suzuki-sugita">From Nought to a Thousand: The HUSCAP Project</a></title>     <articleSummary>Masako Suziki and Shigeki Sugita describe Hokkaido University's efforts to populate its institutional repository with journal articles.</articleSummary>     <issueNumber><a href="/issue49">issue49</a></issueNumber>     <publishedDate>October 2006</publishedDate>     <articleType><a
